div.a: Is This The First Real Alternative To The iPhone?

div.div: If you talk to enough people at the Finnish mobile startup Jolla, at some point it occurs to you that the company it most resembles is Apple. Not the Apple of today, but Apple back when it was Steve Jobs obsessing over the creation of the Macintosh.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WCGxRz&via=Digg&text=Is This The First Real Alternative To The iPhone?

div.a: How Russia Is Freaking Out About The End Of The World

div.div: Inmates in a women’s prison near the Chinese border are said to have experienced a “collective mass psychosis” so intense that their wardens summoned a priest to calm them. In a factory town east of Moscow, panicked citizens stripped shelves of matches, kerosene, sugar and candles. A huge Mayan-style archway is being built — out of ice — on Karl Marx Street in Chelyabinsk in the south.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tu9IoI&via=Digg&text=How Russia Is Freaking Out About The End Of The World

div.a: James Bond And The Killer Bag Lady

div.div: New clues and a powerful Wall St. skeptic challenge the official story of CIA financier Nick Deak's brutal murder.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TBDdp5&via=Digg&text=James Bond And The Killer Bag Lady

div.a: Who Got The Biggest Tax Break In The Last 30 Years?

div.div: Since 1980, total tax rates have fallen for each income group -- rich, poor, and everybody in the middle. But who got the biggest break?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YDLFtT&via=Digg&text=Who Got The Biggest Tax Break In The Last 30 Years?

div.div: In his charming self-portraits, UK-based photographer Caulton Morris likes to present himself upside-down, and often seemingly headless, but always pretty nonchalant about it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TC7DaF&via=Digg&text=Upside-Down Portraits Created Without Photoshop

div.a: Why Does New Love Fade So Fast?

div.div: After tracking 1,761 just-married individuals over the course of 15 years, researchers came to the lamentable conclusion that the boost in emotional bonding that occurs just after marriage begins to fade quickly after about two years.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QYXVDf&via=Digg&text=Why Does New Love Fade So Fast?

div.a: 'Scientists' Uncover Global League Of Mythical Creatures

div.div: How do you know a news story is going to be good? One sure sign is that it opens with the line, "There's a high likelihood that hairs recovered during a state-sponsored expedition in a southern Siberian cave came from a yeti, a prominent Russian cryptozoologist said Tuesday."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11gEF63&via=Digg&text='Scientists' Uncover Global League Of Mythical Creatures

div.div: Skip ahead to 1:55 for the drop.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QA0Dhg&via=Digg&text=Dubstep Christmas House

div.div: All the best parodies and covers mashed up into one video.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SDYJua&via=Digg&text=The Ultimate 'Gangnam Style' Mashup

div.a: The Life And Times Of Kim Dotcom

div.div: Does this “boys and their toys” attitude also overlay a more multifaceted side, one where Dotcom actually holds legitimate insights into complex copyright issues currently plaguing our entertainment industries? Or is Dotcom simply adept at pulling off a flamboyant adult version of an Augustus Gloop-style persona , one cleverly designed to mask digital piracy?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11kAA0D&via=Digg&text=The Life And Times Of Kim Dotcom

div.div: The king of revenge porn says his new site won’t allow stalking after all.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VceWoW&via=Digg&text=Hunter Moore: I Lied!

div.a: Former Spy Chief Says U.S. Has Had Its Cyber '9/11 Warning'

div.div: Former NSA director tells the Financial Times that a cyber attack could cripple the nation's banking system, power grid, and other essential infrastructure.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TvDhXg&via=Digg&text=Former Spy Chief Says U.S. Has Had Its Cyber '9/11 Warning'

div.div: ONE MORE NAIL IN THE HARD DRIVE COFFIN

div.a: Engineers Defeat Limits Of Flash Memory

div.div: Taiwan-based Macronix has found a solution for a weakness in flash memory fadeout.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TuNXVY&via=Digg&text=Engineers Defeat Limits Of Flash Memory

div.a: The Story Behind This Year's Best Television Episode

div.div: How the 'Game Of Thrones' creators managed to fit a six-chapter-long land-and-sea war into 55 minutes of spectacular television.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QUbQKO&via=Digg&text=The Story Behind This Year's Best Television Episode

div.div: Hurricane Sandy obviously had a great deal of impacts but one of the oddest was drawing attention to the unique position of the number zero.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VdqQit&via=Digg&text=Is Zero An Even Number?

div.a: Apple's Wireless-Charging Patent Might Actually Free Us From Wires

div.div: Apple thinks it has found a way to do better wireless charing by using a near-field magnetic resonance power supply.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SpKsS4&via=Digg&text=Apple's Wireless-Charging Patent Might Actually Free Us From Wires

div.a: Five Hours Of Airplane Landings Captured In Thirty Seconds

div.div: Check out this curious 25-second time-lapse/composite video that shows every airplane that landed at San Diego International Airport on Black Friday a week ago between 10:30am and 3pm.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11xeOGj&via=Digg&text=Five Hours Of Airplane Landings Captured In Thirty Seconds

div.a: Steve Jobs Was Wrong, Touchscreen Laptops Don't Suck

div.div: How Windows 8 challenged the 'gorilla arm' — and won.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wz5ayx&via=Digg&text=Steve Jobs Was Wrong, Touchscreen Laptops Don't Suck

div.div: GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE SHROUDED IN SMUG

div.a: San Francisco Needs To Get Over Itself

div.div: San Francisco can’t deal with its good fortune. Every positive turn, here, is met with fresh angst: People worry about that renewed success will ruin the environment, exacerbate class divisions, and make it harder to find parking.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TAd1xc&via=Digg&text=San Francisco Needs To Get Over Itself

div.a: One Of The More Punishing Blocks In College Football

div.div: This would probably be a fine in the NFL. But this isn't the NFL, so play on.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QyD20l&via=Digg&text=One Of The More Punishing Blocks In College Football

div.a: John McAfee Plays Hide-And-Seek In Belize

div.div: Asserting his innocence, Mr. McAfee has become a multiplatform cyberdissident, with a Twitter account, and a blog at whoismcafee.com with audio links, a comments section, photographs and a stream of invective against the government and the police of Belize.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vdl7sO&via=Digg&text=John McAfee Plays Hide-And-Seek In Belize

div.div: AS IF EARTHQUAKES WEREN'T BAD ENOUGH

div.a: Megastorms Could Drown Massive Portion Of California

div.div: Huge flows of vapor in the atmosphere, dubbed "atmospheric rivers," have unleashed massive floods every 200 years, and climate change could bring more of them

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U6d9Ri&via=Digg&text=Megastorms Could Drown Massive Portion Of California

div.div: Learning to cook is hard enough without spills, smells, smoke, and bugs getting in your way. Here are the 10 biggest kitchen annoyances, and the clever methods you can use to solve them.
